title: What happened to the children of the aristocracy during the French Revolution? - Quora

response.answer_text: If there is no answer yet - just to start - something you could find about a destiny of this boy:  Louis XVII of France - Wikipedia but there are several much more sentimental stories available. If we know, that Louis was imprisoned, it seems most of them needed to demonstrate loyalty and - if this poofs were taken in account, they avoided death. During Revolution, in general case, cruelty does not directed towards children - many families need a couple of hands to keep their house, cattle, work in fields so they take cute boys - and, finally, find a decent death somewhere in Cairo, Austerlitz or Borodino. Destiny of cute girls was not so good - if they could not find shelter and patron, it was possible to fall into abyss of vice…
